attributes.action: Iain Duncan Smith to be held accountable for deaths caused by welfare reform.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures released by the DWP on Thursday  27th aug 2015 show that over 80 people each month, died between December 2011 and February 2014 after a Work Capability Assessment (WCA) found them fit to work.

Iain must be held responsible for this as he is overseeing the reforms.

Sources:

http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/anger-government-admits-2380-people-9941649

http://www.rt.com/uk/313623-thousands-killed-benefit-sanctions/

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-34074557
attributes.background: 2,380 people have died within 6 months of being told they are "fit for work" under the plans for welfare reform under the control of Iain Duncan Smith.

rejection.details:
We're not sure what action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take on this issue. 

You could ask for Parliament to debate a vote of no confidence in Iain Duncan Smith, as this is something that the House of Commons could do. You may find that there is already a petition about this on the site.
